unparsed_output: The person whose photograph is shown at the top right side of the page is A. Paul Naney, M.D. '43 (March), chief of the Medical Service and director of the Coronary Care Unit at Clay County Hospital in Flora, Ill., is doing a pilot program for the study of coronary care units in small hospitals under a grant from the U.S. Public Health Department. Dr. Naney took his internship at Presbyterian Hospital in Chicago. After three years as captain in the U.S. Army, he returned to WUMS for post-graduate study in pathology. Following his residency at the V.A. Hospital in McKinney, Texas, Dr. Naney joined the Flora Clinic.
